title: Brain Stem Anatomy
subject: Anatomy
description: Questions on the external structure and features of the brain stem, including the medulla oblongata, pons, and midbrain

questions.questionText: What is the length of the medulla oblongata?
questions.explanation: The medulla oblongata is approximately 3 cm long, extending from the lower border of the pons to the spinal cord.

questions.questionText: Which part of the medulla oblongata forms part of the floor of the 4th ventricle?
questions.explanation: The open medulla, which is the upper half, forms part of the floor of the 4th ventricle.

questions.questionText: What structure on the ventrolateral surface of the medulla is produced by the corticospinal tract?
questions.explanation: The pyramid is an elongated elevation on the ventrolateral surface caused by the corticospinal tract.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: Which cranial nerve exits through the anterolateral sulcus of the medulla?
questions.explanation: The hypoglossal nerve exits via the anterolateral sulcus, separating the pyramid from the olive.

questions.questionText: What overlies the dorsal nucleus of the vagus nerve on the dorsal surface of the open medulla?
questions.explanation: The vagal trigone overlies the dorsal nucleus of the vagus nerve in the floor of the 4th ventricle.

questions.questionText: Which structure is found on the dorsal surface of the closed medulla, overlying the gracile nucleus?
questions.explanation: The gracile tubercle overlies the gracile nucleus on the dorsal surface of the closed medulla.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The pons is divided into which two main parts?
questions.explanation: The pons consists of a ventral basis pontis and a dorsal tegmentum.

questions.questionText: What lodges in the basilar groove on the ventral surface of the pons?
questions.explanation: The basilar groove on the ventral pons houses the basilar artery.

questions.questionText: Which cranial nerve emerges from the cerebellopontine angle?
questions.explanation: The facial (VII) and vestibulocochlear (VIII) nerves exit at the cerebellopontine angle.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: What is produced by the abducent nucleus and encircling facial nerve fibers on the dorsal pons?
questions.explanation: The facial colliculus is formed by the abducent nucleus and the looping facial nerve fibers.

questions.questionText: The midbrain is continuous with which structure superiorly?
questions.explanation: The midbrain lies between the pons and the diencephalon, continuous with the latter above.

questions.questionText: What divides the midbrain into cerebral peduncle and tectum?
questions.explanation: The cerebral aqueduct of Sylvius separates the anterior cerebral peduncle from the posterior tectum.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: Which cranial nerve emerges medial to the cerebral peduncle on the ventral midbrain?
questions.explanation: The oculomotor nerve (III) exits medial to the cerebral peduncle on the ventral surface.

questions.questionText: The four colliculi on the posterior midbrain are also known as?
questions.explanation: The four colliculi (two superior and two inferior) are collectively called corpora quadrigemina.

questions.questionText: Which colliculi overlie visual reflex centers?
questions.explanation: The superior colliculi are associated with visual reflex centers.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The trochlear nerve emerges from which aspect of the brain stem?
questions.explanation: The trochlear nerve (IV) is the only cranial nerve emerging from the dorsal aspect, below the inferior colliculi.

questions.questionText: What connects the superior colliculus to the lateral geniculate body?
questions.explanation: The superior brachium links the superior colliculus with the lateral geniculate body.

questions.questionText: Which sulcus separates the pyramid from the olive in the medulla?
questions.explanation: The anterolateral sulcus separates the pyramid from the olive and allows exit of the hypoglossal nerve.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The inferior cerebellar peduncle connects the medulla to which structure?
questions.explanation: The inferior cerebellar peduncle is a bundle of fibers linking the medulla to the cerebellum.

questions.questionText: What divides the medullary part of the 4th ventricle floor into three triangular areas?
questions.explanation: The inferior fovea divides the dorsal open medulla into hypoglossal trigone, vagal trigone, and vestibular area.

questions.questionText: The transverse pontine fibers collect to form which peduncle?
questions.explanation: Transverse pontine fibers form the middle cerebellar peduncle, connecting pons to cerebellum.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: Which nerve consists of large sensory and small motor roots emerging from the pons?
questions.explanation: The trigeminal nerve (V) has a large sensory root laterally and small motor root medially from the lateral upper pons.

questions.questionText: The dorsal surface of the pons is bounded laterally by which structures?
questions.explanation: The dorsal pons is bounded on either side by the superior cerebellar peduncles.

questions.questionText: What overlies the superior and lateral vestibular nuclei on the dorsal pons?
questions.explanation: The vestibular area overlies the superior and lateral vestibular nuclei.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: The cerebral peduncles emerge from the upper surface of which structure?
questions.explanation: The two cerebral peduncles emerge from the upper surface of the pons and ascend to the cerebral hemispheres.

questions.questionText: Which colliculi overlie lower auditory centers?
questions.explanation: The inferior colliculi are associated with lower auditory centers.

questions.questionText: The superior cerebellar peduncles run along the sides of which ventricle?
questions.explanation: The superior cerebellar peduncles extend downwards, backwards, and laterally along the sides of the 4th ventricle to the cerebellum.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition

questions.questionText: What connects the inferior colliculus to the medial geniculate body?
questions.explanation: The inferior brachium links the inferior colliculus with the medial geniculate body.

questions.questionText: Which sulcus on the dorsal closed medulla is continuous with that of the spinal cord?
questions.explanation: The posterior median sulcus on the dorsal closed medulla continues from the spinal cord.

questions.questionText: The abducent nerve exits from the sulcus between which two structures?
questions.explanation: The abducent nerve (VI) emerges from the sulcus between the pyramid and the pons.
references: Netter's Atlas of Human Anatomy, 7th Edition
